problems.title: Check Power of a Prime
problems.description:
You are given a positive integer N. We say that N is a "power of a prime" if there exists a prime number p and an integer k >= 1 such that N = p^k. Note that k = 1 is allowed, so any prime number itself is considered a power of a prime.
Your task is to check whether N is a power of a prime or not.

Input Format:
A single integer N.

Output Format:
Print "YES" if N is a power of a prime, otherwise print "NO".
problems.examples:
Sample Input
27

Sample Output
YES

Explanation:
27 = 3^3, where 3 is prime.
hintsList: Factorize n into primes. If n = 1, answer is NO. Otherwise, check if n = p^k for some single prime p and integer k>=1 (only one distinct prime factor).
